channel.title: Apache Ant - Compiling Problem
channel.description:
Apache ant always exits out of the batch with theres an error after compiling. If there is no error its fine.
Adding pause doesnt work either. Im pretty sure I've set my variables right but idk. Its not the java version either I've tried different versions.
Any Ideas?
ANT_HOME = D:\Program Files\ANT\bin
JAVA_HOME = D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14
Path = %SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem; D:\Program Files\Samsung\Samsung PC Studio 3\; D:\Program Files\ANT\bin; D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;
Class Path = D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\
Build.xml [code]<project name="Java"> <target name="clean"> <delete dir="bin"/> </target>
<target name="compile"> <mkdir dir="bin"/> <javac srcdir="src/com/rs/worldserver/" destdir="bin"/> </target>
<target name="jar"> <mkdir dir="jar"/> <jar destfile="jar/Server.jar" basedir="bin"> <manifest> <attribute name="Main-Class" value="com/rs/worldserver/Server"/> </manifest> </jar> </target>
<target name="run"> <java jar="jar/Server.jar" fork="true"/> </target>
</project>[/code]

item.title: Apache Ant - Compiling Problem
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

Apache ant always exits out of the batch with theres an error after compiling.
If there is no error its fine.

Adding pause doesnt work either.
Im pretty sure I’ve set my variables right but idk.
Its not the java version either I’ve tried different versions.

Any Ideas?

ANT_HOME = D:\Program Files\ANT\bin

JAVA_HOME = D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14

Path = %SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem; D:\Program Files\Samsung\Samsung PC Studio 3; D:\Program Files\ANT\bin; D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;

Class Path = D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\

Build.xml

[code]


<target name="compile">
    <mkdir dir="bin"/>
    <javac srcdir="src/com/rs/worldserver/" destdir="bin"/>
</target>

<target name="jar">
    <mkdir dir="jar"/>
    <jar destfile="jar/Server.jar" basedir="bin">
        <manifest>
            <attribute name="Main-Class" value="com/rs/worldserver/Server"/>
        </manifest>
    </jar>
</target>

<target name="run">
    <java jar="jar/Server.jar" fork="true"/>
</target>

[/code]

Read full topic
